patterns.name: Sea Level Rise
patterns.description: The document indicates sea level rise is a primary climate hazard for the Nantucket Sound region, providing current rates and future projections through 2100.

patterns.name: Storm Impacts
patterns.description: Major storms, including their frequency, intensity and storm surge levels, are identified as another key climate risk.
patterns.evidence: Frequency: 3 major storms/year; Intensity: Category 1-3 storms; Storm surge: 6-12 feet

patterns.name: Infrastructure Vulnerability
patterns.description: The assessment analyzes the vulnerability of critical infrastructure such as coastal roads, power stations and water treatment facilities.
patterns.evidence: Coastal roads: High vulnerability; Power stations: Moderate vulnerability; Water treatment: High vulnerability

patterns.name: Document Corruption and Recovery
patterns.description: The document demonstrates significant data corruption, but a variety of techniques are used to successfully recover most of the content.
patterns.evidence: Original Records: 85% intact; Recovered Records: 95% intact; Final Validation: PASSED; Recovery rate: 92%

patterns.name: Multi-Temporal Analysis
patterns.description: The assessment examines climate risks across multiple time horizons, from historical baselines to current conditions and future projections.
patterns.evidence: Baseline period: 1990-2020; Analysis period: 2020-2100; Near-term (2020-2030): Original data intact; Mid-term (2030-2050): [RECOVERED] Accelerating impacts; Long-term (2050-2100): [RECOVERED] High uncertainty
